Text: And in light of #AhmaudArberyDay here in Georgia, I want to acknowledge that while this verdict will not bring Mr. Arbery back, I hope that it does bring some peace to his family and friends. https://t.co/D64pYZRYe5
I hope this verdict sets our country on a path to ensure that equal justice for all is finally a reality and not just an ideal.

National attention and the resiliency of Ahmaud‚Äôs family and friends finally brought these three vigilantes to justice. And now all are guilty of committing a federal hate crime.
 
As we reflect on #BlackHistoryMonth, at least in this case we know that justice has been served.

Like so many others, this killing would have remained justified but for a video of the crime, unwittingly made public by one of the perpetrators who thought he was immune from prosecution. https://t.co/FUwBpAuZqT

After #AhmaudArbery was chased down, shot and left to die in the middle of the street by three white men, local police and prosecutors went straight to work, quickly closing the case after ruling the killing was justified. https://t.co/6Zuqahtde4

Mrs. Sheila Chamberlain, first black woman combat pilot; Mr. Barrington Irving, who holds the record for youngest to pilot a plane solo around the world; and Mr. Charles Flanagan, first African American pilot for Delta Airlines.
I will honor these aviators and other Black pioneers for their courage and perseverance which paved the way for later generations to pursue careers in aviation:
Today at 1 p.m. I'm hosting my #BlackHistoryProgram: "Blacks in Aviation, Past & Present." https://t.co/cc0NuWPbFO https://t.co/cSHBXAVbSm

We will conclude the program with a special announcement in regards to my Minorities in Aviation Education Act (https://t.co/dYaJiSmg6a) which would create a grant program aimed at improving the preparation and representation of minorities in aviation-related fields.

I'm honored to spotlight the three now-deceased #TuskegeeAirmen from the 4th Congressional district: Mr. Val Archer, Mr. Andrew Keyes and Mr. Vernon Sport.

I will also interview Master Sgt. W.O. Smith, one of the nearly 400 Tuskegee Airmen still living. https://t.co/EqU8ZbqQnE

Join me tomorrow at 1 p.m. for my virtual #BlackHistoryMonth program: "Blacks in Aviation, Past & Present." https://t.co/cc0NuWPbFO

The program will honor the history of black pioneers for their courage and perseverance which paved the way for later generations. https://t.co/REvbHm2X9C
